|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 512 |ram1chip = Winbond;W632GG6KB-12; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43465; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL, |rad2txchains = 4 |rad2rxchains = 4 |rad2sstreams = 4 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam2 = 800 |rad2n = 600 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 |rad2correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad2cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== ''High performance 802.11ac Wave 2 with dual 5GHz radios'' ''and multi-gig Ethernet support''
*[[Aruba Networks AP-344 (APIN0344)]]: External antenna models *[[Aruba Networks AP-345 (APIN0345)]]: Internal antenna models {{See also|Aruba Networks|Wistron NeWeb}} One of the two radios may be configured as 2.4GHz or 5GHz allowing the device to broadcast two 5GHz networks. 5GHz 802.11ac mode is either 4SS/VHT80 or 2SS/VHT160. {{See also|Mist Systems AP41|Netgear WAC740}} The MicroUSB jack is a proprietary serial console interface.
[[Category:English Documentation]]
